entities.description: "Tversky index is an extension of the dice loss that uses a weight trading precision and recall, offering more flexibility."
"Dice loss is a method used to address data-imbalanced datasets, and it is a soft version of the F1 score."
"Focal loss is a strategy that adjusts weights of training examples in proportion to (1-p), emphasizing hard examples."
"Importance sampling is a method that assigns weights to different samples to change the data distribution."
"AdaBoost is a boosting algorithm that selects harder examples to train subsequent classifiers."
"Hard example mining is a technique that downsamples the majority class and exploits the most difficult examples."
"Oversampling is a method used to balance the data distribution."
"Self-paced learning is a method where example weights are obtained through optimizing the weighted training loss, encouraging learning easier examples first."
"IoU-balanced sampling is a method proposed to alleviate the class imbalance issue in object detection."
"Generalized Dice Loss is used as the training objective for unbalanced tasks, with class re-balancing properties."
"Batch soft Dice loss function is used to train CNN networks for segmentation tasks."
"Kahn and Marshall are researchers who introduced the concept of importance sampling in 1953."
"Kanduri et al. are researchers who contributed to the understanding of boosting algorithms like AdaBoost."
"Malisiewicz et al. are researchers known for their work on hard example mining."
"Chen et al. 2010 are researchers who contributed to the field of oversampling to balance data distribution."
"Chawla et al. are researchers who have worked on oversampling techniques for data distribution balance."
"Lin et al. are the researchers who introduced the concept of focal loss in 2017."
"Kumar et al. are researchers who have worked on self-paced learning."
"Chang et al. are researchers who have worked on adjusting the weights of training examples based on training loss."
"Katharopoulos and Fleuret are researchers who have contributed to the field of adjusting training example weights."
"Jiang et al. are researchers who proposed learning a separate network to predict sample weights."
"Fan et al. are researchers who also proposed learning a separate network to predict sample weights."
"Li et al. are researchers who have studied the background-object label imbalance issue in object detection."
"Girshick is a researcher who has contributed to the field of object detection, particularly with hard negative mining."
"He et al. are researchers who have worked on object detection and the background-object label imbalance issue."
"Girshick et al. are researchers known for their work on hard negative mining in object detection."
"Ren et al. are researchers who have contributed to the field of object detection."
"Pang et al. are researchers who proposed the IoU-balanced sampling method."
"Chen et al. 2019 are researchers who designed a ranking model to replace the conventional classification task."
"Sudre et al. are researchers who addressed the severe class imbalance issue for image segmentation tasks."
"Shen et al. are researchers who investigated the influence of Dice-based loss for multi-class organ segmentation."
"Kodym et al. are researchers who proposed using the batch soft Dice loss function for training CNN networks."

relationships.description: "Tversky index extends the concept of dice loss by incorporating a weight that trades precision and recall."
"Dice loss and focal loss are both used to address the issue of easy-negative examples dominating training in imbalanced datasets."
"Importance sampling and AdaBoost both involve assigning weights to samples, but Importance sampling changes the data distribution while AdaBoost selects harder examples."
"Hard example mining and Oversampling are both techniques used to address data imbalance, but they focus on different aspects of the problem."
"Self-paced learning and focal loss both involve dynamic weight adjustment during training, but they have different focuses and methods."
"IoU-balanced sampling and Generalized Dice Loss are both methods proposed to address class imbalance issues, but in different contexts."

entities.description: "Cross Entropy Loss is a method used to calculate the loss in classification problems, where each instance contributes equally to the final objective."
"Sørensen–Dice Coefficient, or DSC, is an F1- oriented statistic used to gauge the similarity of two sets, particularly in the context of boolean data."
"Tversky Index is related to the Dice Coefficient and is used in the context of measuring similarity between sets."
"Milletari et al. are referenced for proposing a change in the denominator of the Dice Coefficient to the square form for faster convergence."
"Valverde et al. are cited in the context of discussing the challenges of selecting appropriate weighting factors for different classes in classification tasks."
"$x_{i}$ represents an instance in the training set, associated with a binary label and contributes to the calculation of Cross Entropy Loss and Dice Coefficient."
"$y_{i}$ represents the golden binary label denoting the ground-truth class that instance $x_{i}$ belongs to."
"$p_{i}$ represents the predicted probabilities of the two classes for instance $x_{i}$."
"$\alpha_{i}$ is the weighting factor associated with instance $x_{i}$, used to adjust the Cross Entropy Loss equation."
"$n_{t}$ is the number of samples with class $t$, used in the calculation of the weighting factor $\alpha$."
"$n$ is the total number of samples in the training set, used in the calculation of the weighting factor $\alpha$."
"$K$ is a hyperparameter used in the calculation of the weighting factor $\alpha$."
"$A$ represents the set containing all positive examples predicted by a specific model."
"$B$ represents the set of all golden positive examples in the dataset."
"TP stands for True Positive, used in the calculation of the Dice Coefficient."
"FP stands for False Positive, used in the calculation of the Dice Coefficient."
"FN stands for False Negative, used in the calculation of the Dice Coefficient."
"$\gamma$ is a smoothing factor added to the Dice Coefficient formula for handling negative examples."

relationships.description: "Both Cross Entropy Loss and Sørensen–Dice Coefficient are used in the context of evaluating classification performance, though they serve different purposes."
"Cross Entropy Loss and Tversky Index are both statistical measures used in classification, with Tversky Index being an extension of the Dice Coefficient."
"Sørensen–Dice Coefficient and Tversky Index are related measures used to evaluate the similarity between sets, with Tversky Index being a generalization of the Dice Coefficient."
"Milletari et al. proposed a modification to the Sørensen–Dice Coefficient by changing the denominator to the square form for faster convergence."
"Valverde et al. are referenced in the context of discussing the challenges associated with the selection of weighting factors in Cross Entropy Loss for multi-class classification tasks."
"Instance $x_{i}$ is associated with the binary label $y_{i}$, which denotes its ground-truth class."
"Instance $x_{i}$ has predicted probabilities $p_{i}$ for the two classes."
"Instance $x_{i}$ is associated with the weighting factor $\alpha_{i}$, which adjusts its contribution to the Cross Entropy Loss."
"The weighting factor $\alpha_{i}$ is calculated using the number of samples with class $t$, $n_{t}$."
"The weighting factor $\alpha_{i}$ is calculated using the total number of samples in the training set, $n$."
"The hyperparameter $K$ is used in the calculation of the weighting factor $\alpha_{i}$."

"arXiv is a repository of electronic preprints (known as e-prints) approved for publication after moderation, but are not peer-reviewed."
"Chinese Treebank is a collection of datasets used for part-of-speech tagging and parsing in Chinese language processing."
"CTB5 is a dataset for tagging and parsing in Chinese, containing 507,222 words, 824,983 characters, and 18,782 sentences."
"CTB6 is an extension of CTB5, containing 781,351 words, 1,285,149 characters, and 28,295 sentences."
"Universal Dependencies is a framework for consistent annotation of grammar across different human languages."
"UD1.4 is a dataset used for Chinese part-of-speech tagging within the Universal Dependencies framework."
"OntoNotes is a dataset used for Named Entity Recognition, consisting of texts from various sources and containing multiple entity types."
"MSRA is a Chinese benchmark dataset for Named Entity Recognition, containing 3 entity types and collected from news domain."
"CoNLL2003 is an English dataset with 4 entity types used for Named Entity Recognition."
"SQuAD is a question-answering benchmark, with SQuAD v1.1 and SQuAD v2.0 being the most widely used."
"Quoref is a QA dataset that tests the coreferential reasoning capability of reading comprehension systems."
"MRPC is a corpus of sentence pairs with human annotations indicating whether the pairs are semantically equivalent."
"QQP is a collection of question pairs from Quora, used to determine if the questions are semantically equivalent."
"Xinhua is a news agency and a source of articles in the CTB5 dataset."
"The Information Services Department of HKSAR is a source of articles in the CTB5 dataset."
"Sinorama Magazine is a source of articles in the CTB5 and CTB6 datasets."
"Wu et al. is a reference to a group of researchers who used the same data split as mentioned in the text."
"Ma and Hovy are researchers whose data processing protocols were followed for the CoNLL2003 dataset."
"Quora is a community question-answering website and the source of the QQP dataset."
"SQuADv1.1/v2.0 refers to the two versions of the SQuAD question-answering benchmark."
"Queref is the source of the QA dataset used for machine reading comprehension."
"Ma and Hovy, 2016 is the publication event of the research paper by Ma and Hovy, which provided data processing protocols."
"CoNLL2012 is the shared task event that provided the standard train/dev/test split for the OntoNotes5.0 dataset."

relationships.description: "arXiv is the platform where the preprint about lattice LSTM is published."
"CTB5 is a part of the Chinese Treebank collection of datasets."
"CTB6 is an extension of the Chinese Treebank dataset CTB5."
"UD1.4 is a dataset within the Universal Dependencies framework."
"MSRA is a Chinese benchmark dataset that is part of the OntoNotes collection."
"CoNLL2003 and OntoNotes are both datasets used for Named Entity Recognition."
"SQuAD and Quoref are both QA datasets used for machine reading comprehension."
"MRPC and QQP are both datasets used for paraphrase identification."
"CTB5 includes 698 articles from Xinhua as part of its dataset."
"CTB5 includes 55 articles from the Information Services Department of HKSAR."
"CTB5 includes 132 articles from Sinorama Magazine."
"CTB6 includes articles from Sinorama Magazine."
"Chinese OntoNotes4.0 uses the same data split as Wu et al."
"The data processing protocols for CoNLL2003 were followed as described in Ma and Hovy, 2016."
"The QQP dataset is a collection of question pairs from Quora."
